intro: Arthrosolen glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-green moss, is a member of the family Dicranaceae. It is a small, delicate moss that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a prostrate growth habit with slender, branching stems covered in a dense layer of leaf-like structures. Its leaves are usually narrow and pointed, with a bluish-green hue that gives it its common name. Arthrosolen glaucescens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
